reviews.title: Well worth a try
reviews.text: Very good modern architecture of the building, well equiped and spacious rooms, a good restaurant and as Aveiro is a small town well situated and at walkable distance to main points of interest..

It's a smart modern hotel, but soul-less as previous reviewers said. 'Interesting' architecture, but with some serious design drawbacks. Very OK for a small business event, but not for a holiday. Aveiro is quite small, but the hotel is relatively far outside - just a few minutes (and a few euros) by taxi to the town centre, but an unsheltered walk of 15-20 minutes - too far to walk often, especially in case of hot sun or rain. The old part of town is small but quite nice, but there is also a large new shopping mall, standard europe. Someone mentioned 'the beach' but it's far away - we tried Costa Nova by taxi: 15 minute journey! But there was a good seafood restaurant there.
reviews.title: Don't choose it for a leisure trip.

reviews.text: The hotel rooms are good - quiet, roomy and comfortable, big bed. But the hotel has been badly designed in details. E.g. you have to sign a personal responsibility form to get them to unlock the huge window, because it's so easy to fall out! There is no outdoor sitting space, and limited lounge/bar sitting space, so you are stuck in your room. The area around the hotel is good in parts - some recently landscaped, but also still work in progress around, so the general view is not always great.

description: Melia Ria Hotel & Spa is located in a superior quality residential development in the centre of Aveiro, with views of the lake formed by the Ria de Aveiro. Located next to the Cultural and Congress Centre and the train station, just a short distance from the historical heart of the city, 7 km from the beaches, and 60 minutes from Oporto airport, with easy access to the A1, A25 and IC1 highways.
